title: Tom Green says his fake wedding to Drew Barrymore on Saturday Night Live is 'something I regret'
text:
He was famously married to Drew Barrymore for only five months.

But one of comedian Tom Green's biggest regrets in life is still that he pretended he was going to marry the 44-year-old Charlie's Angels star as a joke during his 2000 Saturday Night Live hosting gig.

'I try not to have regrets, but that is something that I actually regret,' he told The Last Laugh podcast on Tuesday.

False start: One of comedian Tom Green's [L] biggest regrets in life is still that he pretended he was going to marry future wife Drew Barrymore [R] during his Saturday Night Live hosting gig. Seen here in 2000

The 48-year-old star of Freddy Got Fingered teased the audience throughout his November 18 SNL hosting gig that he and his then fiance were going to tie the knot by the end of the show.

'She’s out in the hallway in her wedding dress, my parents are there in the audience,' explained Tom.

'And then at the end of the show, she doesn’t show up. And the end of my SNL I have a meltdown on stage.'

'And it’s a complete meltdown and the band stops playing and the entire cast disappears and I’m just standing alone on stage at the very end of the show.'

The 48-year-old star of Freddy Got Fingered [L in 2018] teased the audience throughout his November 18 SNL hosting gig that he and his then fiance [R, in March 2019] were going to get married by the end of the show

But the former MTV host regretted not ending his show in the traditional way.

'It does sort of ruin my beautiful SNL kumbaya moment,” he told the podcast.

'At the end of every SNL, [the host] is hanging out with the cast and celebrating together.'

'I think it just sort of ruined my SNL experience,' Green said of the finale, which involved him yelling 'I thought you loved me!' into the air.

Different: What the former MTV host really regretted was not getting to end his show in the traditional way. Green with Barrymore on the set of SNL in 2000

Though Green has only been married once, Barrymore is now thrice-divorced, having split with most recent husband Will Kopelman in 2016.

Before Will, Drew was married to Green from 2001 to 2002.

They had dated since 1999, and he also snagged a part in her 2000 smash hit film Charlie's Angels, in which she starred alongside Lucy Liu and Cameron Diaz.

Her first marriage was to a Los Angeles bar owner called Jeremy Thomas, and lasted two months in 1994 - when she was all of 19 - before she filed for divorce.
